comment.author: 48889055628@N01
comment._content: Henrietta Louise Goelet, married Robert Goelet in 1879. One of their children, Beatrix, is famous for having posed for a John Singer Sargent portrait, titled simply Beatrice Goelet.

comment.author: 49015875@N00
comment._content: or is it the wife of en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Robert_Walton_Goelet ?

comment.author: 54904823@N00
comment._content:
I wrote that biography of Robert Walton Goelet for Wikipedia, so we must have come across them here before tangentially. I usually start a biography based on the photos here.

[http://www.flickr.com/photos/floridamemory/4009469338/]

comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: Another option: NYT of March 18, 1914 query.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=9A04E3DC163AE633A... DIVORCE GRANTED TO MRS. R. GOELET She was Elsie Whelen, daughter of Henry Whelen of Philadelphia, according to the article. He was son of Ogden Goelet.

comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: More on Elsie Whelen later in her life at: www.amb-cotedazur.com/French-Riviera/chateau-la-napoule/D... www.sienese-shredder.com/2/lanie_goodman-the_quirky_quixo... and around the time of her marriage to Goelet query.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=FB0615F73B5F13718... query.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=FB0F1FFA355F13718... en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Leopold_Seyffert indicates that she was painted by Seyffert in 1913, www.nytimes.com/2010/07/06/nyregion/06portraits.html?page... indicates that the portrait is owned by Ralph Lauren.

comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: I found a photo of the former Elsie Whelen, at: chroniclingamerica.loc.gov/lccn/sn84026749/1919-08-17/ed-... The Washington times. (Washington [D.C.]) 1902-1939, August 17, 1919, FINAL EDITION, The American Weekly Section, Image 25 It could be the same woman, but isn't a certain match. But a drawing from before her marriage to Robert Goelet looks very similar to the Bain photo above in pose and hairstyle: chroniclingamerica.loc.gov/lccn/sn83030193/1903-11-17/ed-... The evening world. (New York, N.Y.) 1887-1931, November 17, 1903, Night Edition, Image 4
